clues.text: Epidemic parotitis isn't parrot fever, it's this disease that causes swelling of the neck, usually in childhood
A German pharmacist derived this drug from opium circa 1804, delighting doctors who thought it safe
In the 1950s a culture from an 11-year-old boy led to the first vaccine against this, a vax back in the news in 2025
It's an adjective meaning relating to the lower jaw
The bacterial type of this inflammation of the membranes covering the brain can be deadly & requires immediate medical attention
$1 U.S. will get you about 500 in the currency of Costa Rica that bears an explorer's name-not the Cristóbal but this
Grab the check for your dinner of méchoui & harira in this largest African nation in area & you'll be paying in dinars
Prince Mieszko I, who ruled in the 10th century, is on Poland's note worth 10 of these currency units
20 E.U. member countries use the euro, including this former Yugoslav republic, the newest one to adopt the currency
Ask someone to share a few bob in Kenya or Uganda & you might get the currency called this, like an old British coin
This brand of fizzy water originated in Wisconsin & its name rhymes with enjoy, so stop trying to sound French when you say it
R.I.P. this 1-calorie soda, 1963-2020, the Coca-Cola company's first diet beverage but not its last
When does a bitter alkaloid extracted from tree bark equal refreshment? When it's this distinctly flavored ingredient in tonic water
It contains safrole, an aromatic oil banned by the FDA in 1960; before that, it was the "root" in most commercial root beer
Champagne's fizzy Italian cousins include prosecco & this type of sweet sparkling wine made in Piedmont

"Yeah!" by Usher featuring Ludacris & this rapper & producer spent 12 weeks at the top spot
Santana would first enter the Top 10 in 1970 with "Evil Ways" but their first No. 1 is this song from 1999
In 1973 The O'Jays hit No. 1 with "Love Train" & Gladys Knight & the Pips also topped the chart with this train
75% of the world's volcanoes are part of this 25,000-mile-long seismic belt formed around the basin of the Pacific Ocean
In 2 Kings a chariot of fire & horses of fire appear before this prophet is taken by a whirlwind to heaven
"The Firebird" was a feather in the cap of this Russian composer
Napalm is similar to this Byzantine weapon invented by Callinicus of Heliopolis & named for the people who first used it
A 1963 New York Times review said that James Baldwin had "not written this book of two essays to please"
"'There is no maiden fairer than the Empress of La Mancha, the peerless Dulcinea del Toboso'"

"I had of course long been used to a halter... & to be led about in the fields & lanes quietly, but now I was to have a bit & bridle"

"The second-oldest secret society for women in the U.S.", Phi Mu has a motto-"Les Soeurs Fideles", which translates to this
Around 1951 Tri Sigma began funding research to beat this disease, aka infantile paralysis; happily, they soon needed a new goal
The Bee Gees were a band of brothers; the DGs are this Greek org. founded in 1873 before the term "sorority" was even used
Sen. Blanche Lincoln & Nancy Walton Laurie, a daughter  of Walmart's co-founder, were Chi Omegas at this state school

rounds.comments: (Ken: But you don't have to spell your response.)

clues.text: It's the "R" in the musical genre name "R&B", & it's a bit tougher to spell than the "B"
A handy spelling mnemonic: this word referring to writing paper has an "E" for "envelope"; its homonym has an "A" for "at rest"
To avoid spelling this Yiddish word for, say, your BTS snow globe, try an easier-to-spell synonym like "curio" or "doodad"
At least to the James Beard Foundation, there's no "N" on the menu when spelling this word for the owner of an eatery
These pups were called "badger dogs" to disassociate them from Germany after WWI; as a bonus, the non-German name was easier to spell
Martinis can have many garnishes but to be called a Gibson, it must have this one
Making a Shandy can be as simple as combining a tart soda & this alcoholic beverage
After a hot summer day, unwind with ranch water, a combination of soda, lime & the Blanco variety of this potent potable
The bright green grasshopper combines cream, Crème de Cacao & this herbal liqueur
Want an old fashioned? Combine whiskey, sugar & bitters from this company based in Trinidad & Tobago
Oh, the drama! Melpomene is the muse of lyre playing & of this branch of drama
She & Tristan drink a love potion meant for her & Tristan's uncle
Stheno & Euryale are her equally monstrous sisters, though she is the only one who is mortal
To learn hidden secrets & mysteries is to "lift the veil" of this Egyptian goddess associated with death & rebirth
The daughter of the Cretan King Minos, she helps Theseus escape the labyrinth by giving him a thread to help him find his way out

are chronicled in a written record or diary

rounds.text: Opened in 1902, it's 87 feet in width on the 22nd Street side & less than 7 feet wide at its narrowest point on 23rd Street
